note: Lecturer, researcher, ally, living with MS My research interests include autism, gender identity, education, social justice, inclusion and intersectionality (this list is not exhaustive).  My doctoral research focused on the lived educational experience of autistic trans and non-binary students in the Republic of Ireland.  #actuallyautistic #participatoryresearch #autism #genderidentity #multiplesclerosis

note: I am an occupational therapist and work in a Community Mental Health Team in Cornwall. I live with Martyn and our spaniel cross Reggie. I have lived in Cheshire, Derbyshire, Suffolk, Merseyside, North Yorkshire, and currently the Tamar Valley. In my spare time, I enjoy reading, watching films and TV, walking, nature, the countryside, jigsaws, colouring, and embroidery. My main hobby is taking photos of Devon, Cornwall, and sometimes further a field. I'm also practising my street photography.

Some people like things I do or say. I swear. I mean no harm. Ever.
I hope to occasionally be a light for anyone in a dark place through humor. Neurodiverse.
Rodger and Jessica Rabbit may be my actual cartoon parents.
